results.title: Psychotic disorders: schizophrenia
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Eve Cote and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Schizophrenia is a psychotic disorder characterised by abnormalities of thought (strange beliefs, persecution complexes), abnormalities of perception (hallucinations, hearing voices) and speech abnormalities. The exact cause of schizophrenia is unknown, but it is thought to be in part a genetic predisposition and in part the result of environmental stress. This program surveys current research and theories on the causes and characteristics of schizophrenia.

results.title: Psychotherapy
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 22 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
Therapy to treat mental illness can be divided into two main areas - biomedical therapy and psychological therapy. Biomedical therapy is usually administered by psychiatrists and neurosurgeons and involves physical intervention in the form of psychosurgery (eg. lobotomy), ECT (Electro Convulsive Therapy) and drug therapy. Psychological therapy, in contrast, concentrates on changing behaviour, attitudes and our thoughts. It includes psychodynamic/psychoanalytic techniques, behaviourism, cognitive therapy, humanistic therapy and family or couple therapy. Philip Zimbardo examines all these forms of therapy in this program which also features Dr Albert Ellis and Dr Rollo May.

Psychological therapy, in contrast, concentrates on changing behaviour, attitudes and our thoughts. Philip Zimbardo examines all these forms of therapy in this program which also features Dr Albert Ellis and Dr Rollo May.

results.title: Psychosocial development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: 2 1/2 to 6 years”.
Describes the social and emotional stages of development of the toddler, up until the end of the pre-school years. These include self-awareness, interacting and socializing with others, developing self-control, learning new roles and skills. Looks at the theories of Erikson for this age level as well as issues of discipline, developing empathy and the child’s natural curiousity about their body.

results.title: Psychosexual differences. No. 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
Looks at the physiological and genetic origins of sexually differentiated behaviour. Jeffrey Grey talks about his research with rats and the kind of role reversals he can initiate by the manipulation of hormones.

results.title: Psychopathology
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 21 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
It is estimated 1 in 5 Americans suffer from some form of mental disorder. What is mental illness? What causes it? In this video, Philip Zimbardo of Stanford University examines psychopathology, the study of mental disorders. Clinical psychologists discuss the various factors that can lead to mental and behavioural disorders, including schizophrenia, depression and phobias and then explain the need to classify mental illness to ensure appropriate treatment.

results.title: Psychoneurotic conditions: obsessive-compulsive neurosis
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Presents the case-history of a middle-aged man who, despite good education and intellect has been unable to hold a job during the five years prior to the start of treatment for an obsessive-compulsive neurosis. Includes the patient’s feelings about his symptoms and his progress in therapy.

results.title: Psychomatic conditions: obesity
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Disordered Mind”.
A case history of a psychosomatic condition. Describes the unhappiness of an overweight 13 year old girl, who eats because she is depressed and is depressed because she is overweight. There is a lack of communication between the girl and her mother which causes frustration. Dr Henry Kravitz discusses the treatment to be used between the girl and her parents.

results.title: Psychology: the study of human behavior
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, David Stone and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description: A series of half hour programs on psychology covering cognition, behaviourism, social psychology, psychological disorders and their treatment and the relationship between mental and physical health.
